page.title: 02A SOUTH HYLTON CHARACTER
page.content: Mr. Storey lives in a small isolated cottage by the dismantled Sunderland to Durham railway line. The house was originally a gate keeper's cottage first inhabited in 1852 by Mr. Storey's great grandparents. Mr. Storey has lived there for 74 years. The cottage is a stone built 2 storey building having one bedroom upstairs and a living room and kitchen down- stairs. It is about a mile from the nearest transport or shops and "Wilfie", has to walk everywhere. The house has a cold water tap but no other amenities. Mr. Storey uses calor gas for lighting, heating and cooking. He also has a coal fire on which he can heat water. He uses a zinc tub as a bath. Mr. Storey likes living there. He has plenty of friends who call in but he sometimes gets lonely at night.
